dict.string: Float the brandy on top of the Benedictine. Some people prefer it on the rocks, some prefer it slightly warmed. Serve after dinner, or as a nightcap.
Pour tequila into a tall glass containing ice cubes. Add the orange juice, then carefully pour in the grenadine, letting it sink gradually into the glass creating the illusion of a sunrise.
Place the juice, sugar, egg white and gin into a cocktail shaker with cracked ice. Give it a good shake, and strain into a Highball glass. Top off the frothy mix with a few ounces of cold soda water.
Mix the tequila and vermouth with some cracked ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a slice of lime.
Pour the Tia Maria into a shot glass, and pour the Irish Cream over a spoon so it floats on top. It should look like a miniature pint of stout.
Place the vodka and vermouth into a shaker with ice. Mix, and then pour into a chilled glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
Shake the ingredients with ice, and serve in a chilled glass.
Place the ingredients in a blender with ice, and blend until smooth. Frozen pineapple can be used if fresh pineapple is not available. Place in freezer for a few hours before serving.
Couldn't be simpler: pour the orange juice into a champagne flute, then add the champagne.
Fill the glass half full of the light beer, and then carefully pour the dark beer in over an upside-down spoon so that the two don't mix.
Mix the vodka and schnapps in a glass with ice cubes, and then add the orange juice.
Mix all the ingredients in a glass, and forget about going to work tomorrow.
Pour the creme de cassis into the glass, and add the champagne. Stir until the color is pale. Serve cold.
Mix both the ingredients in a highball glass with ice. Garnish with a slice of orange.
Place all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice, shake well, and then strain into a cocktail glass.
Place ingredients into a cocktail shaker with crushed ice, and shake vigorously. Serve with a sprig of fresh mint over shaved ice.
Pour each ingredient into a brandy snifter and serve without ice.
Put all ingredients in blender with some ice. Blend for 30 seconds, and serve over ice cubes.
Mix the ingredients together in the glass, with ice cubes. Add fresh cream to top off glass and stir until well-mixed.
Shake well with ice, and strain into a tall glass filled with ice. Garnish with pickled asparagus sprig or slice of celery.
Shake the ingredients well with ice, and finely strain into a Martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange rind.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender, mixing until the ice is crushed to a slushy consistency. Garnish with a pineapple slice.
Fill a shot glass 2/3 full with Irish Cream and gently float the lime juice on top. Drink immediately.
Pour contents into cocktail shaker with ice, and shake vigorously. Strain into a sugar rimmed cocktail glass garnished with a lemon wheel.
Add club soda to a tall glass with ice, and add a dash of grenadine.
Pour the ingredients into a shot glass. That's it.

Gently bruise the mint leaves with a muddler or similar implement in the bottom of an empty tall glass. Add the sugar, lime, and the rum. Fill the glass with ice cubes. Stir well, and top the glass with club soda.
Shake well and pour into tall glass with ice. Decorate with fruit.
Mix the ingredients well in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, and strain into a chilled glass. Add a sweetener (for example, simple syrup) to taste.
Mix the ingredients in a glass, and top with soda water. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Mix ingredients in a large glass with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass, and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Serve without ice in a martini glass, with a twist of lemon peel as garnish.
Mix the ingredients with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Mix the ingredients in a glass with ice, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Mix the rum, the banana liqueur, the lime juice, the banana and the ice well in a blender. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Fill a Collins glass up about two-thirds with cracked ice. Add a little sugar, the lemon juice and the gin. Stir well. Top off glass with club soda. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Add a few drops of the bitters to the glass, and then pour in the gin. Add an ice cube and top up with water to taste.
Pour over ice and mix with flat cola. Drink with caution: this is quite strong.
Pour a splash of vermouth into a mixing glass, and add gin. Stir and serve with olives.
Mix ingredients, and pour over ice.

Pour a splash of dry vermouth into a mixing glass. Add ice, stir and empty the liquid out of the glass. Pour the gin. Stir well. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Squeeze lemon zest and garnish with green olive.
Add the ingredients to a cocktail glass, and garnish with a cherry.
Shake the ingredients well with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garish with a twist of orange.
Salt and a small dish for frosting

Chill a high glass. Twist some lemon juice on the mouth of the glass and turn it upside-down into a salt-filled dish to create the frosting. Add some ice. Pour in the tequila, then the grapefruit soda. Stir as needed then decorate with a lemon rind.
Shake the ingredients with ice, and then strain into a cocktail glass. Sugar rim on the glass.
Pour ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
Add the ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice, and mix well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Pour the Kahlua into a shot glass, then slowly pour in the tequila so that two distinct layers are formed. Set fire to the tequila with a lighter and allow the blue flame to burn.

Add the orange and 1 tsp of sugar or simple syrup into an Old Fashioned glass. Add a maraschino cherry (without stem) and the bitters. Fill glass with ice. Add bourbon and stir. Serve with short straw.
Mix the ingredients, and serve in a Collins glass garnished with an orange slice and cherry.
Muddle the mint leaves and the syrup in a tall glass. Add shaved or crushed ice and then the bourbon. Garnish with another sprig of mint.
Rub the rim of a highball glass with the lime. Fill the glass with ice, and add the rum. Fill the glass with cola, and drop in the lime.
6 oz cold dry champagne or other dry sparkling wine

Fill a tall flute glass half way full of chilled stout and float the sparkling wine on top of the stout. The differing densities of the liquids allow them to remain largely in separate layers. The effect is best achieved if it is poured over a spoon turned upside down over the top of the glass so that the liquid runs gently down the sides rather than splashing into the lower layer and mixing with it.
Add the ingredients with crushed ice to a cocktail shaker. Mix well, and serve.
Mix all the ingredients, serve in a copper mug with ice.

Fill a shot glass half way with Irish Cream, then layer half a shot off Goldschlager on top. Add splash of flammable alcohol. Dim the lights and ignite. Sprinkling cinnamon into the flame will cause sparks to appear in an otherwise dim blue flame.
Combine all the ingredients in a shaker, and mix with ice. Strain into a sugar-rimmed glass.
Mix the ingredients, and serve in a cocktail glass with a slice of orange.
Mix the ingredients in a cocktail shaker, and serve in a highball glass.
Mix ingredients in blender, and serve in tall glass with ice. Garnish with slice of pineapple.
Stir tequila, vermouth and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and top with the olive then serve.
Shake the ingredients and strain into an Old Fashioned glass over ice cubes. Garnished with a lemon twist.
Mix ingredients and serve in a Collins glass with ice and filled with soda. Garnish with lime wheel.
Add ingredients to a cocktail shaker, and mix with ice. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry.
Shake the gin, the lemon juice and sugar with ice. Strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water or club soda, stir and serve.
Put the crushed ice, rum, honey and cream in a blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth. Strain into a cocktail glass. Serve without garnish.
Pour the absinthe into a flute glass, and top with the champagne.
Pour Kahlua into glass with ice. Top off with ginger ale.
Stir all ingredients in a cocktail shaker, and mix with cracked ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredient (except the soda) in a cocktail shaker, and strain into highball glass. Top with soda. Garnish with orange slice and cherry.
Place ingredients into an iced highball glass then pour into a shaker for a few shakes. Pour back into glass. Garnish with a squeeze of lime and serve.
Mix the rum, the blue curacao, the pineapple juice and the cream of coconut with ice in a cocktail shaker. Strain into a highball glass and garnish with a cherry and a piece of pineapple.
Shake or stir with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
Pour the drambuie over ice. Add the scotch and give it a quick stir.
First add the grenadine into a tall glass, then the curacao and then the orange liqueur.
Pour the ingredients over ice and squeeze in a slice of lime.
Half-fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, add the vodka and orange juice and mix well. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Gently float the Galliano on top and garnish with the orange slice.
Combine the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and strain into a cocktail glass.
Mix all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Put a metal spoon in a wine glass and pour in the hot coffee. Leave about 1.5 cm space above the coffee. Mix two tsps of sugar and the whiskey into the coffee and remove the spoon. Hold a tablespoon upside down over the glass and slowly pour the cream over the back of the spoon onto the surface of the coffee mixture. It should float.
Mix the ingredients with crushed ice in a blender and served with a pineapple stick in an lowball glass.
Pour the tequila into a shot glass. Splash in a couple drops of Tabasco sauce.
Mix ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.
1 measure Kahlua or other coffee liqueur
Mix the ingredients in a glass with ice, and pour into a shot glass.
Pour the ingredients into a highball glass half-full of ice. Top off with club soda and garnish with maraschino cherry.
Mix all of the ingredients (except for the chambord) in a cocktail shaker with ice and pour into a Martini glass. Then add the chambord to the glass and allow it to sink to the bottom.
Mix the ingredients well in a cocktail shaker of ice. Pour into a cocktail glass, with a garnish of nutmeg powder.
Add the ingredients to a Collins glass, with plenty of ice. Stir well, and add a splash of coke. Garnish with lemon twist.
